subject: RE: [junit] How to get test's name in JUnit 4
msgSnippet: Kevin, My sense of the question was a little different. It sounds like Gabriel is using the name field to store a file name. In JUnit 4 there is no name field.
messageBody:
Kevin,

My sense of the question was a little different. It sounds like Gabriel is
using the name field to store a file name. In JUnit 4 there is no name
field.

Gabriel, if this is true I recommend that you declare your own name field
and initialize it for every instance. You can use the Parameterized test
runner to do much of the work for you:

@RunWith(Parameterized.class)
public class FileTest {
@Parameters
public static Collection<Object[]> data() {
return Arrays.asList(new Object[][] { { "file1" }, { "file2" } });
}
private String fileName;
public FileTest(String fileName) {
this.fileName= fileName;
}
@Before public void openFile() { ... }
@After public void closeFile() { ... }
@Test public void test() {
...
}
@Override public String toString() {
return getClass().getName() + "." + fileName;
}
}

Regards,

Kent Beck
Three Rivers Institute
